pages.text: The best place to get started. Here are the most basic recipes of $(turtlemancy)Turtlemy$().

pages.title: Pearl & Cooked Oyster
pages.text: You will get a cooked oyster too!

pages.title: Improved Scute
pages.text: Like scute, but better. What an amazing item. One of the hardest materials.

pages.title: Turtle Curse
pages.text: Why would you want a $(turtle) to $(thing)curse$() you?

pages.title: Turtle Bless
pages.text: If you are searching for this recipe, you probably don't deserve it.

pages.title: Glass
pages.text: You throw Sand. You obtain Glass. No furnace needed. Easy Business.

pages.title: Dried Kelp
pages.text: I know what you are thinking, $(playername). How can you $(thing)dry$() something in the $(thing)water$(), right? Well, you are right. I don't understand it either. $(turtlemancy)Turtles$() are that amazing.

pages.title: Glowstone Dust
pages.text: Thanks to the luminous property of the pearl and the redstone and a tiny bit of the turtle magical power, you are now obtaining Glowstone!

pages.title: Crying Obsidian
pages.text: Poor obsidian. Why would you make it cry? Anyways, if you are a $(turtlemancer) you can make obsidian cry. Just... don't tell the police.

pages.title: Gunpowder
pages.text: I guess creepers are now obsolete...

pages.title: Mossy Cobblestone
pages.text: Get started with your green invasion!

pages.title: Mossy Stone Bricks
pages.text: Get started with your green invasion - part II!

pages.title: Blaze Rod
pages.text: Magmatic turtles aren't useless after all!.

pages.title: Fragment of Bedrock
pages.text: The other way around! You get 9 Fragments of Bedrock with this recipe.
